title: Atropa
data: {{version032}} {{flavour|It is tipped with a substance that causes blindness and brief confusion.}} '''Atropa''' is a [[brand]] found only on [[dart]]s. When a creature is struck with an atropa-tipped dart, it will be [[blind]]ed and may become [[confusion|confused]]; the blindness will last longer than the confusion. Unlike most brands, atropa's effectiveness is determined by the player's skill in [[Throwing]] and [[Stealth]], and resisted by the target's [[hit dice]]: *The chance is 100 - 100 * (HD - 2) / (4 + pow), where pow = (Throwing + Stealth) * 2 / 3{{source ref|0.32.0|throw.cc|249}}. *For monsters with [[HD]] < 15, there is a 3% chance to succeed anyway even if the above chance fails. ==Strategy== Atropa is probably most effective when used for setting up [[stab]]bing opportunities, but any fight is made easier if your opponent can't see you or think straight. Atropa works well enough on early threats like [[list of gnolls|gnolls]] or [[orc warrior]]s, but without investment in Throwing and/or Stealth, these darts will be mostly useless on monsters by the time you reach the [[Lair]]. ==Trivia== [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atropa Atropa] refers to a genus of poisonous plants, the most well-known of which is [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atropa_belladonna Belladonna] (a.k.a. Deadly Nightshade). ==History== *Prior to [[0.32]], atropa-tipped darts couldn't blind players. *Atropa was introduced in [[0.24]], replacing the old [[confusion (brand)|confusion]] brand found on [[needle]]s. ==References== {{brands}}
